en: i believe it is a subject that should be discussed so that those who suffer know and feel supported and those who commit bodyshming come to know the negative impact it can have on someone's life.

en: i believe that after the reports that are submitted within social networks where we see abuse of this type, the sanctions are not adequate. the most common answer is that the content does not violate the rules and is not deleted and the people who commented have no sanctions for their actions

original: Smatram da bodyshaming iznimno jako utječe na mentalno zdravlje osobe. Svakako, svi bi trebali biti informirani o zdravom načinu života kakvo god tijelo imali bitno da zivimo zdravo, jedemo zdravo i uravnotezeno i krecemo se :) sve ono sto promovira suprotno od toga smatram jednako losim kao  i bodyshaming
en: i believe that body shaming has an extremely strong impact on a person's mental health. certainly, everyone should be informed about a healthy lifestyle, no matter what kind of body they have, it is important to live healthy, eat healthy and balanced and exercise :) i consider everything that promotes the opposite to be as bad as body shaming

original: Credo che ognuno debba e posare del proprio corpo ciò che ritenga più opportuno. La libertà è qualcosa di sacro che nessuno ha il diritto di intaccare. C'è chi prova ad esserlo e cerca di non dar peso al giudizio (non richiesto) della gente, ma nonostante questo resta vittima di questo fenomeno. Alla luce di questo credo che si dovrebbe trovare il modo di ostacolare gente che cerca di calpestare i propri simili sentendosi subiriore e calpestando la libertà altrui.
en: i believe that everyone should pose with their body what they deem most appropriate. freedom is something sacred that no one has the right to undermine. there are those who try to be one and try not to give weight to people's (unsolicited) judgment, but despite this they remain victims of this phenomenon. in light of this, i believe that a way should be found to hinder people who try to trample on their peers by feeling subjugated and trampling on the freedom of others.

original: Consider că bodyshamingul online este o problemă serioasă ce trebuie tratată cu mai multă atenție pentru a o putea combate.
en: i believe that online bodyshaming is a serious problem that needs to be treated more carefully in order to combat it.

original: Acredito que pessoas com deficiência não merecem ser julgadas pelo seu infortúnio e deveriam ser cuidadas pois a sua condição é irreversível, porém para quem têm a capacidade de melhorar a sua vida ao incorporar um estilo de vida saudável e opta por desperdiçar essa chance única que a vida dá é triste e vai ouvir sempre dos outros, é assim que a sociedade funciona e sempre funcionou. Há males que vêm para bem.
en: i believe that people with disabilities do not deserve to be judged for their misfortune and should be cared for because their condition is irreversible, however for those who have the ability to improve their lives by incorporating a healthy lifestyle and choose to waste this unique chance that life gives is sad and will always hear from others, this is how society works and has always worked. there are evils that come for good.

original:
Considero que les persones adolescents són molt més susceptibles a patir els efectes d'aquest tema en el físic, en l'autoestima, en la salut mental, etc i és molt fàcil i perillós
que siguin propenses a patir trastorns de la conducta alimentària, ansietat, depressió, inseguretat, etc i s'ha d'intervenir a temps perquè tingui el menor impacte possible en els seus camins a l'adultesa. Tanmateix, més enllà de l'intervenció, el més important és la prevenció.
en: i believe that teenage people are much more susceptible to the effects of this issue in the physical, in the self-esteem, in the mental health, etc. and it is very easy and dangerous that are prone to suffer from eating disorders, anxiety, depression, insecurity, etc. and you must intervene in time so that it has the least possible impact on their paths to adulthood. however, beyond intervention, the most important thing is prevention.

original: Considero que este tema devia ser mais abordado, pois as vítimas tendem a culpar-se. O body shaming não reflete o corpo delas, mas sim a intolerância de quem as julga. Ao conversarmos sobre este assunto podemos, efetivamente, lutar por ajudar quem precisa e consequentemente tornar o mundo real e online mais puro e humano.
en: i believe that this topic should be addressed more, as victims tend to blame themselves. body shaming does not reflect their bodies, but rather the intolerance of those who judge them. by talking about this subject we can effectively fight to help those in need and consequently make the real and online world more pure and human.

original: Θεωρώ οτι πρέπει να εκπαιδευτούν οι χρήστες να κάνουν report οταν βλέπουν τετοιες συμπεριφορές online
en: i believe that users should be trained to report when they see such behaviors online

en: i can't understand how anyone gets the right to talk that way about someone else on the internet. the screen does protect the abuser.

en: i compare my body a lot with other people i see on social media, and the diet videos, weight loss exercises, tips, and all of this makes me rethink my body and not like it (i don't think it's body shaming)

en: i find that nowadays the ideals that society imposes are unacceptable. too fake and perfect, so much so that the convention of true reality has now been lost...

original: Μεγάλωσα σε ένα σπίτι που πάντα το να έχεις παραπάνω κιλά αποτελούσε πρόβλημα, και πάντα επιβραβευομουν όταν ήμουν αδύνατη, αυτό με ακολούθησε σε όλη την πορεία της ζωής μου, με αποτέλεσμα τα υπερφαγίκα επεισόδια, έντονες αυξομειώσεις βάρους, και αυτοκοινωνικο αποκλεισμό τις περιόδους που είμαι με παραπάνω κιλά.
en: i grew up in a home where being overweight was always a problem, and i was always rewarded when i was thin, this has followed me throughout my life, resulting in binge eating episodes, extreme weight fluctuations, and self-social exclusion during periods when i am overweight.

original: Sou docente universitária há alguns anos, numa faculdade onde é muito fácil constatar empiricamente que os números dos estudos existentes em Portugal sobre incidência de problemas de saúde mental na Academia, não têm qualquer adesão à nossa realidade. Em abril passado tivemos o terceiro suicídio em 2 anos. Tudo tabu, o que leva a que a faculdade nem sequer admita justificações de faltas por nada remotamente próximo. Mesmo tabu, eu consigo sem pensar muito apontar 15 alunos que falaram disso comigo. Quando pergunto, nunca algum me disse não saber de 20 a 30 colegas na mesma situação ou pior. No meio disto, o verdadeiro tabu nem é este. É que a epidemia é idêntica entre docentes. Tofos os años há alguien que desiste e vai embora, mas suportamos torturas psicológicas variadas anos a fio  em claro síndrome de Estocolmo. E não, pior do que ousar ter uma depressão, só reaparecer na faculdade com o dobro do peso. justifica uma conversa previa dos colegas de equipa com o regente, pedindo-lhe que nao comente essa questão dado que o problema foi serio e ninguém lida bem com o facto de passar dos 45 aos 90kg em 3 meses. Náo é muito apreciado que as assistentes engordem ligeiramente. Ser “extravagante” (que ali significa não ser cinzento igual a todos), é uma outra forma de garantir uma curta carreira.
en: i have been a university professor for a few years, at a faculty where it is very easy to empirically verify that the numbers of existing studies in portugal on the incidence of mental health problems in the academy, have no connection with our reality. last april we had the third suicide in 2 years. everything is taboo, which leads to the fact that the college does not even allow excuses for absences for anything remotely close. even though it's taboo, i can without thinking too much point to 15 students who talked about this with me. when i ask, no one has ever told me that they don't know of 20 to 30 colleagues in the same situation or worse. in the midst of this, the real taboo isn't even this. the epidemic is identical among teachers. every year there is someone who gives up and leaves, but we endure varying psychological torture for years on end in clear stockholm syndrome. and no, worse than daring to have depression, only to reappear in college with twice the weight. justifies a prior conversation between teammates and the conductor, asking him not to comment on this issue given that the problem was serious and no one deals well with the fact of going from 45 to 90kg in 3 months. it is not very appreciated that assistants gain a little weight. being “extravagant” (which means not being gray like everyone else) is another way of guaranteeing a short career.

original: έχω παρατήσει πως συχνά στην διαδικτυακή πλατφόρμα TikTok ότι νεαρά κοριτσια με παραπάνω κιλά ή με σώματα που δεν πληρούν τα στερεότυπα και το «ιδανικό» σώμα της κοινωνίας να δέχονται αρνητικά σχόλια έως και ευχές θανάτου. en: i have given up how often on the online platform tiktok that young girls with extra pounds or with bodies that do not meet the stereotypes and the "ideal" body of society receive negative comments and even death wishes. i really feel ashamed and i really don't understand how they can have no empathy for their fellow man

en: i have never suffered any type of body shaming but the idea that it could happen to me and that i end up not liking my body scares me. this is why i believe that on a psychological level, being subjected to body shaming can be very influential. personally, it would really touch me deeply and regulate my actions and my way of being in private and in society.

en: i have witnessed many incidents where the person being targeted is someone with a physical or cognitive disability. the seriousness is that a person with a disability cannot do anything to change their body or functioning, they have no room to attempt improvement to be more accepted. this has devastating consequences on a personality already vulnerable due to ableism

en: i think it is important to talk to young people about the body and that what we see on the internet is not always the case in reality, and to show them examples so that they can be convinced, and not that everything is just words. encourage them to support and encourage each other.

original: Crec que és sobretot un tema educatiu molt relacionat amb el capitalisme i el patriarcat. Se'ns educa per al consum de cossos i ens creiem que tot el que és public a les xarxes socials és per al nostre consum, i com a consumidors ens sentim amb la impunitat d'opinar.
en: i think it is mostly an educational issue very related to capitalism and patriarchy. we are educated for the consumption of bodies and we believe that everything that is public on social networks is for our consumption, and as consumers we feel with impunity to have an opinion.

original: Πιστεύω ότι είναι κάτι που είναι πολύ ασχημο και πρέπει οπωσδήποτε να σταματήσει
en: i think it is something that is very ugly and must definitely be stopped

original: Crec que és massa difícil fer callar a les veus que no tenen bones intencions. És més fàcil que cada persona sàpiga ignorar aquests comentaris o prendre mesures de manera independent.
en: i think it is too difficult to silence the voices that do not have good intentions. it is easier for each person to know how to ignore such feedback or take action independently.

original: Mislim da je jako teško reagirati u npr. komentarima jer se često dogodi da se body-shaming nastavi i na osobu koja reagira. Mislim da bi bolji sustav prijavljivanja kršenja smjernica na platformama možda pomogao
en: i think it is very difficult to react in e.g. comments because it often happens that body-shaming continues on the person who reacts. i think a better system for reporting policy violations across platforms might help

original: Θεωρώ ότι είναι μία συμπεριφορά που επηρεάζει πολύ τους ανθρώπους, ειδικότερα μικρότερα κορίτσια και αγόρια στην εφηβεία και την νεαρή ενηλικίωση που πιθανόν δεν έχουν αναπτύξει μηχανισμούς άμυνας ώστε να μην επηρεάζονται.
en: i think it's a behavior that affects people a lot, especially younger girls and boys in adolescence and young adulthood who probably haven't developed defense mechanisms to not be affected.

original: penso che sia una cosa orribile che può distruggere la salute mentale e fisica delle persone. le persone che lo fanno non pensano alle conseguenze e sono ignoranti e arroganti
en: i think it's a horrible thing that can destroy people's mental and physical health. people who do this don't think about the consequences and are ignorant and arrogant

en: i think it's an online phenomenon that we've gotten used to, although we shouldn't.

original: acho que é incentivar as pessoas a viverem menos o mundo virtual
en: i think it's encouraging people to live less in the virtual world

original: Consider ca e important sa nu judecam lumea dupa cum arata. Atat timp cat sunt sanatosi si fericiti, nu ar trebuii sa ne pese. Totisi, recent, am observat un fenomen de body-pozitivity excesiv in care si daca persoana considera ca trebuie sa se schimbe dpdv fizic pt binele ei, tot este incurajat sa se iubeasca asa cum este. Daca se spune mereu ca putem fi mai buni , de ce nu se aplica si dpdv fizic? Practic eu cred ca toata lumea ar trebuii sa fie mai activa si sa aiba grija de corpurile lor mai bine. (Excludem persoanele care au limitari din cauza unor boli sau alte aspecte pe care nu le pot controla)
en: i think it's important not to judge the world by how it looks. as long as they are healthy and happy, we shouldn't care. however, recently, i have noticed a phenomenon of excessive body-positivity in which even if the person considers that he must change physically for his own good, he is still encouraged to love himself as he is. if it is always said that we can be better, why doesn't it also apply physically? basically, i think that everyone should be more active and take better care of their bodies. (we exclude people who have limitations due to diseases or other aspects that they cannot control)

original: Creo que se podrían hacer más cosas para poder evitar que pase esto tan frecuentemente, este tipo de cosas afecta mucho a la gente, unas más que a otras.
en: i think more could be done to prevent this from happening so often, this type of thing affects people a lot, some more than others.

original: crec que la gent aprofita que no hi ha cap tipus de conseqüència per ficar-se amb l’altre gent mantenint-se amb l’anonimat, haurien d’estar més restringits els comentaris
en: i think people take advantage of the fact that there is no consequence to mess with other people by staying anonymous, comments should be more restricted

original: Crec que tot i que les xarxes social intenten tenir un control respecte als comentaris negatius, haurien de fer més. Però, soc conscient que en aquest contextos, a vegades, és difícil posar límits i tenir un bon control.
en: i think that although social networks try to have control over negative comments, they should do more. but, i am aware that in this context, sometimes, it is difficult to set limits and have good control.

original: Penso che di base il problema sia che chi fa body-shaming ha per primo insicurezze profonde e vive male con se stesso, ed è la conseguenza di insegnamenti che ci vengono impartiti su come debbano apparire ed essere fatti i corpi umani
en: i think that basically the problem is that those who do body-shaming first of all have deep insecurities and live badly with themselves, and it is the consequence of teachings that are given to us on how human bodies should look and be made.

original: Penso che considerare la libertà di espressione come libertà di offendere (perché il body shaming è questo) è uno dei fattori che contribuiscono all'esistenza di questo fenomeno
en: i think that considering freedom of expression as freedom to offend (because body shaming is this) is one of the factors that contribute to the existence of this phenomenon

original: penso che ognuno di noi si deve sentire accettato prima da noi stessi e poi in caso anche dagli altri
en: i think that each of us must feel accepted first by ourselves and then also by others if necessary

original: mislim da je edukacija najvažnija i učenje djece empatiji
en: i think that education is the most important and teaching children empathy

original: crec que lo seu seria no necesariament prendre mesures legals cap a l'agressor, si no prendre mesures legals contra les xarxes, no deuria de ser possible dir aquestes barbaritats baix l'anonimat d'internet
en: i think that it would not necessarily be necessary to take legal measures against the aggressor, if not to take legal measures against the networks, it should not be possible to say these barbarities under the anonymity of the internet

original: Creo que las redes deberían ser más estrictas con los perfiles falsos, ya que considero que la mayoría de cuentas destinadas al abuso de este tipo son cuentas falsas que enmascaran a la persona que busca hacer ese daño.
en: i think that networks should be stricter with fake profiles, since i consider that the majority of accounts intended for abuse of this type are fake accounts that mask the person seeking to do that damage.

original: Penso que nos dias de hoje este tipo de comportamento está cada vez pior, e infelizmente, cada vez mais normalizado. Ao publicar uma foto numa rede social a sua repercussão e o tempo para circular e chegar a um elevado numero de pessoas pode ser enorme em questão de minutos, até segundos. Especialmente online, parece que as pessoas estão cada vez mais confortáveis para desrespeitar e atacar os outros baseando-se em ideais irreais e pouco acertados, com uma vista de corpo-padrão que é injusta e que foge ao real e normal de um ser humano
en: i think that nowadays this type of behavior is getting worse and worse, and unfortunately, more and more normalized. when publishing a photo on a social network, its repercussion and the time it takes to circulate and reach a large number of people can be enormous in a matter of minutes, even seconds. especially online, it seems that people are increasingly comfortable disrespecting and attacking others based on unrealistic and inaccurate ideals, with a standard view of the body that is unfair and deviates from what is real and normal for a human being.

original: Penso que les xarxes social són un reflex de la societat actual però que permet als individus actuar de forma més cruel amagant-se darrere d’una pantalla.
en: i think that social networks are a reflection of today's society but that it allows individuals to act in a more cruel way hiding behind a screen.

en: i think that the most significant consequence of this phenomenon can be seen in food, as people tend to change their diet in order to achieve certain standards of beauty, even if this "new way of life" is a dangerous one for health

original: El problema més general és l’ús excessiu d’Internet i la falta de dissociació entre el món real i el virtual, especialment les xarxes socials. S’hauria de fer servir plataformes digitals que facin servir algoritmes diferents, perquè intentar combatre el contingut ofensiu, tant a nivell de físic com polític, racial… només alimenta l’algorisme. en: the most general problem is the excessive use of the internet and the lack of dissociation between the real and virtual worlds, especially social networks. these are governed by algorithms that seek interactions, and polarizing content is the one that has the most interactions, both by those who support it and those who oppose it. digital platforms that use different algorithms should be used, because trying to combat offensive content, both physically and politically, racially... only feeds the algorithm. the real change would be to normalize diverse bodies in all media and at the local level.
